name: WordPress Live Webcam Widget & Shortcode
author: Michelangelo Scotto di Gregorio

sections.description: With this plugin is possible to include a live webcams by using a remote stream. You can use JPEG, MJPEG or CGI streamed in a widget or in a post/page by using the [webcam] shortcode.
sections.installation:
• FTP Installation
  1. Upload the wordpress-webcam folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the WordPress Live Webcam Widget & Shortcode plugin through the Plugins menu in WordPress
  • WordPress Installation
  1. Go to Plugins menu and click on Add new.
  2. Click on Upload plugin.
  3. Select the .zip file that contain the plugin
  4. Click on Setup now
  5. Activate the WordPress Live Webcam Widget & Shortcode plugin through the Plugins menu in WordPress
sections.faq:
HTTPS is supported?

Yes. You can use HTTP or HTTPS.

RTMP/RTSP is supported?

No. Because it required a streaming server.

FTP URL is supported?

Yes. You can a public FTP or with string ftp://user:password@hostname:21/image.mjpg

Can I use a non-standard port on URL?

Yes, you can.

short_description: Embed a webcam into Wordpress site. It's possible to embed a MJPEG stream or simple JPG.
description: With this plugin is possible to include a live webcams by using a remote stream. You can use JPEG, MJPEG or CGI streamed in a widget or in a post/page by using the [webcam] shortcode.
